Package ss.pentago.network.server

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.network.server.GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    GameManager continually matches the first two players that enter the game queue. Furthermore, it keeps track of current matches being played and provides methods for updating current games. This class also takes care of sending the appropriate commands to both players before, during, and after a match.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameManager

        public GameManager​(Server server)
        Create a new GameManager object. The GameManager matches queued players and keeps track of their matches.
        Parameters:
        server - the server

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        While running, continually tries to match the two front most players in the queue. This happens on a configurable interval.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the GameManager. This will ensure this GameManager thread will terminate.

      • queue

        public boolean queue​(ClientHandler user)
        Queue the user if they are not in the game queue. Dequeue them if they are in the queue.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to (de)queue
        Returns:
        true when the user was queued, false when they were dequeued

      • addNewMatch

        public void addNewMatch​(ClientHandler player1,
                        ClientHandler player2)
        Start a match between two users. This removes them from the queue, and sets up the new game.
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player

      • updateMatchOf

        public boolean updateMatchOf​(ClientHandler player,
                             int position,
                             int rotation)
        Update the board of the match the specified player is playing in.
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        position - the position index
        rotation - the rotation index
        Returns:
        false when the move was invalid or no match was found, true otherwise

      • endMatchIfPresent

        public void endMatchIfPresent​(ClientHandler disconnectedUser)
        Checks if the user who disconnected was in a match, if so, that match is removed, and both players receive a game over due to disconnection message. Furthermore, this will reset the still connected player's game status. This will also increment the match counter. Does not require that player is actually in game or not. It will double check again.
        Parameters:
        disconnectedUser - the user that disconnected during the match

      • getNrMatchesPlayed

        public int getNrMatchesPlayed()
        Retrieve the number of matches player on the Server, a match is counted when either it resulted in a victory, a draw, or a disconnect.
        Returns:
        the number of matches played
